unit_learning_outcomes.description: evaluate key modes relating to both historical and contemporary documentary production.
analyse the historical production context of both early and contemporary audio and audiovisual documentary works.
evaluate and reflect on the relationship of current trends in audio and audiovisual documentary works to the contemporary digital environment.
apply key documentary concepts in the analysis of a range of audio and audiovisual non-fiction works.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Listening or viewing set media works (documentaries)

assessments.description: Students are required to write a close analysis of one of the films set for viewing in the first half of the semester, with reference to the associated required reading. Refer to iLearn for further information.

Students will offer commentaries on the set readings and required screenings from the first few weeks of the semester. They will provide explanations of the arguments presented in the readings Refer to iLearn for further information.

In this assessment students are asked to write a research essay in response to one of the set questions provided. The essay will critically compare two documentary works by drawing on key terms of analysis offered during the unit, as well as additional scholarly sources. Refer to iLearn for further information.

Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: MMCC2065 - Documentary Media: Forms, Histories, Futures

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: From its first gestures in the early twentieth century in radio and film to current multimedia experiments, the documentary has proved to be a resilient and compelling form. This unit examines the development of documentary and its current relationship to rapidly proliferating digital technologies across a range of formats - including radio, television and broadcasting, cinema, podcasting and online.
data.search_title: MMCC2065 - Documentary Media: Forms, Histories, Futures
